16. WRAPPINGS AND CONTAINERS

Mention any changes which you recall in the wrappings and containers received with the food you purchased (give dates where possible). In the initial everything except flour, baking soda, salt or cornstarch was just into caps before your eyes. Of course much of the ready-to-eat canned food was not seen.

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner and supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer.

Beef Stew, Potatoes, Peas, Carrots, Bread & Butter, Eggs, Butter, Milk, Coffee.

18. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in Western Canada? 1922.

Give the menu. List those present and give their approximate ages at the time.

Roast Beef, Potatoes, Vegetables, Plum Pudding, Mince Pie. Everyone in the country were invited to the celebration. Not sure how many came. My mother helped seventeen families celebrate.

In the eighties, Mother went to town once a month to buy supplies. She bought almost everything there. She was looking for everyone, things she unlocked at the general store. Sometimes she bought us some candy or something to watch her and see her before them.
